conclusion: Need to analyze the acceleration-time graph to determine elevator state at t=4.5s
Graph shows acceleration as a function of time; positive acceleration means upward movement, negative means deceleration or downward movement
Acceleration decreases linearly from t=4s to t=5s
Acceleration at t=4.5s is average of accelerations at t=4s and t=5s
Acceleration at t=4s is 2 m/s^2 and at t=5s is 0 m/s^2
Elevator is in overload if acceleration > 9.8 m/s^2; in weightlessness if negative acceleration magnitude > 9.8 m/s^2
Acceleration at t=4.5s is 1 m/s^2, less than 9.8 m/s^2, so elevator is neither in overload nor weightlessness
Final conclusion: Elevator is neither in a state of weightlessness nor overload at t=4.5s
